text: Obedient to the policy of his King, de Vienne avoided trouble at sea as cleverly as Du Guesclin avoided it on land. Gaunt was compelled to give up his search for an elusive foe, and, afraid to return home without something to show, he foolishly attempted to besiege the well-protected fortress of St Malo. This involved the dreary method of mining operations in which Gaunt, under the Black Prince, had shown considerable skill at the siege of Limoges.
handwritten_text: Obedient to the policy of his King, de Vienne avoided trouble at sea as cleverly as Du Guesclin avoided it on land. Gaunt was compelled to give up his search for an elusive foe, and, afraid to return home without something to show, he foolishly attempted to besiege the well-protected fortress of St Malo. This involved the dreary method of mining operations in which Gaunt, under the Black Prince, had shown considerable skill at the siege of Limoges.
